meanings.definition: Lack of moderation or restraint in behavior or speech.
meanings.sent1: Her intemperatenesses in talking often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: His intemperatenesses at the party made everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the intemperatenesses of his character, making the audience laugh.
meanings.sent4: The intemperatenesses of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's intemperatenesses in grading caused frustration among the students.

meanings.definition: Excessive indulgence in food or drink.
meanings.sent1: Their intemperatenesses at the buffet resulted in upset stomachs.
meanings.sent2: The intemperatenesses of the feast left no leftovers for the next day.
meanings.sent3: The intemperatenesses of the chocolate cake tempted even the most disciplined dieter.
meanings.sent4: Her intemperatenesses with wine made her the life of the party.
meanings.sent5: The intemperatenesses of the celebration left everyone in high spirits.
